title: playground: word wrapping affects line numbers
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Visit http://play.golang.org/p/EfOOCquXd3
2. Change your browser's width until the lines wrap
3.

What is the expected output?
The first line should have line number 1, the second line should have line number 2.
Word wrapping should not affect the numbering, and "fake" lines should have no
own line numbers.

What do you see instead?
Depending on your browser's width, line 1 will span multiple lines and affect future
line numbers.

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
n/a

Which operating system are you using?
Chromium Version 26.0.1410.43 (189671) on Gentoo Linux
Firefox 17.0.3 on Gentoo Linux

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
n/a

Please provide any additional information below.
It'd be easy to dismiss this issue because Go code shouldn't be so ridiculously wide,
but when inlining XML or JSON this issue can actually arise a lot easier.
